alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 10:41PM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Johnson Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Oconee...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 23 feet, Moderate flooding continues. Portions of the Old Balls Ferry Road leading to the boat ramp becomes flooded with a foot of water or more. The entire dirt parking lot near the boat ramp is under three to five feet of water. Extensive flooding of the woodlands near the river continues. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 21.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM EDT Thursday was 21.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 17 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.1 feet on 09/30/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
